page.title: 01Bridgerule Today
page.content: Years ago, this small village which is cut in two by the River Tamar, was known as East and West Bridgerule - the eastern half being in Devon and the western half in Cornwall. Now the whole village is deemed in Devonshire, but the Primary School keeps its old title of East Bridgerule Voluntary Primary School. The original site for the village was at Churchtown where St.Bridget's Church is situated but with the advent of adequate flood controls and drainage,the main buildings grew up in the valley and now form the village. The surrounding countryside is good fertile farmland with fields and hedges interspersed with areas of copse. Bridgerule is situated in between Holsworthy,Devon, and Bude,Cornwall.
